Sentence.sentence: The company pledged to cut 600 back-office positions, though some 150 workers in those roles would be reassigned to other jobs.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It helped Bluemercury establish its position worldwide.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At a time when young beauty shoppers are often turning to Sephora or Ulta instead of department store beauty counters, Macy's hopes Bluemercury will help strengthen its position in the category.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Building on a Soviet-era foothold, Russia is expanding its monitoring stations for Glonass, its version of the Global Positioning System ( ' , GPS).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And we also need to plan ahead so that we're in a position to deal with the likely levels of climate change which are already inevitable and even more so too for the levels that are likely if we don't get those global agreements.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: As more data are collected and methods for analysis improve, researchers will be in a better position to identify how different experiences, behaviors and environments relate to each other and evolve over time, with the potential to improve people's produ
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So I thought it would be wise to take out forward exchange cover to protect our position on the outstanding contract.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: The ability to work well with others and collaborate on projects is a sought-after ability in nearly every position.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The Arctic sea ice holds a central position in the Earth's climate system and it's deteriorating faster than expected.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: They didn't really articulate any position regarding the actual business plan.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: What sealed Nokia's fate was a series of decisions made by Stephen Elop in his position as CEO, which he assumed in October 2010.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"职位"之意。
means: place ： 指任何不分高低贵贱的职位；有时侧重指在政府、法庭所谋求的职位。
position ： 侧重指社会地位较高，工作较为庄重，领取工资的职位。
post ： 普通用词，指人的职务，职位，岗位。
situation ： 正式用词，一般指雇员或为富有人家工作所担任的职位，现多见于广告中。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"地点，位置，场所"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: place, position, spot, situation, site, location, locality, setting, scene
means: place ： 含义广泛，最普通用词，既可指很小的地点，又可指很大很远的地方或场所。
position ： 多指物体相对于其他物体所处的位置或状态。
spot ： 指相对较小的特定地点或事物所在地。
situation ： 指物体在其周围环境中所处的位置或状态，侧重地点或场所的环境特征。
site ： 指或大或小的地方，既可指供专门用途或特定活动的地点，又可指某一事件的地址。
location ： 指某物设置的方向或地点。
locality ： 指某物所处的客观位置和周围地区。
setting ： 一般特指戏剧或小说所写的环境或场所。
scene ： 常指真实事件或虚构故事发生的地点。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"态度，立场"之意。
means: stand ： 常指某人对某一问题的看法或立场，有时含个人感情色彩。
attitude ： 普通用词，指对于事情的看法和采取的行动，多带不很显确或不便说明的感情色彩。
position ： 指对看法有分歧的问题所表示较冷静和节制的态度，常常是经认真考虑后决定的。

stems_affixes.word_buile: ap加强动作+posit放+e→放得好→适当的
com共同+posit放+e→放到一起→混合物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 肯定的,积极的,绝对的,无疑的,正的
stems_affixes.word_buile: posit放+ive……的→确定"放"→肯定的,积极的,主动的
ap加强+posit放+ion表名词→放在一起→并置
com共同+posit放+e→放到一起→混合物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 保管人,受托人,受托公司,存放处,储藏所,仓库
stems_affixes.word_buile: deposit存放+ary人,物或场所→n.保管人,受托人,受托公司,存放处,储藏所,仓库
de下去+posit放+ion表名词→放下去,沉淀

stems_affixes.value_cn: 排列,部署;性格倾向;倾向,意向
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+posit放+ion表名词→分开放→安排→引申为人的喜好,心情
ex出+posit放+ion表名词→放出去,暴露
im进去+posit放+ion表名词→进去放[强放]→强加接受

stems_affixes.value_cn: 位置;职位;姿势,姿态;见解,立场,形势
stems_affixes.word_buile: posit放+ion表名词→放置的地方→位置;职位

stems_affixes.value_cn: 主张, 建议, 陈述, 命题
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro赞同+position见解,立场→赞同……见解,立场→主张, 建议

stems_affixes.value_cn: 贮藏室,智囊团,知识库,仓库
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+posit放+ory场所,范围→重新[不断]放东西的地方→仓库

word_mean: 位置，体位：在某些情况下，病人为自己舒适所采取的体位或姿势，或为便于进行某种诊断或治疗操作使身体处于的特定位置
胎位：在产科学中，通过胎儿先露部分某一特定位点(方向位点或关系位点)与母体骨盆冠状面上某一特定位点的关系，描述确定胎儿在骨盆中的位置状态。各种胎位见表。参见presentation
为了完成一定的工序，一次装夹工件后，工件（或装配单元）与夹具或设备的可动部分一起相对刀具或设备的固定部分所占据的每一个位置。

Sentence.sentence: His analysis should therefore end any self-contentedness among those who may believe that the global position of English is so stable that the young generation of the United Kingdom do not need additional language capabilities.

sentences.en: From time to time he shifted his position on the handlebars.
sentences.cn: 他不断地变换着握把的姿势。

entry.def: The position of someone or something is the place where they are in relation to other things.

example.ex: The ship was identified, and its name and position were reported to the coastguard...
example.tran: 那艘船已找到，其名字和位置已报告给海岸警卫队。

example.ex: This conservatory enjoys an enviable position overlooking a leafy expanse.
example.tran: 这个温室位置绝佳，放眼望去，草木繁茂，郁郁葱葱。

entry.def: When someone or something is in a particular position, they are sitting, lying, or arranged in that way.

example.ex: Hold the upper back and neck in an erect position to give support for the head...
example.tran: 挺直上背部和脖子来支撑头部

example.ex: Ensure the patient is turned into the recovery position...
example.tran: 确保使患者处于复苏体位。

entry.def: If you position something somewhere, you put it there carefully, so that it is in the right place or position.

example.ex: Position trailing plants near the edges and in the sides of the basket to hang down...
example.tran: 把蔓生植株靠边放，使其从篮子的四面垂下。

example.ex: Place the pastry circles on to a baking sheet and position one apple on each circle.
example.tran: 把油酥面圈放到烘烤盘上，每个上面放一个苹果。

entry.def: Your position in society is the role and the importance that you have in it.

example.ex: ...the position of older people in society.
example.tran: 老年人在社会中的地位

entry.def: A position in a company or organization is a job.

example.ex: He left a career in teaching to take up a position with the Arts Council...
example.tran: 他辞去教学工作到艺术委员会任职。

example.ex: Hyundai said this week it is scaling back its U.S. operations by eliminating 50 positions.
example.tran: 现代公司本周表示其美国分公司准备裁掉50个职位以缩小经营规模。

entry.def: Your position in a race or competition is how well you did in relation to the other competitors or how well you are doing.

example.ex: Agassi and Sampras resumed their battle for the world's No. 1 position, both winning their opening matches...
example.tran: 阿加西和桑普拉斯继续他们对世界第一宝座的争夺，两人在首场比赛中均获得胜利。

example.ex: By the ninth hour the car was running in eighth position.
example.tran: 到第9个小时的时候，这辆车位列第8。

entry.def: You can describe your situation at a particular time by saying that you are in a particular position .

example.ex: He's going to be in a very difficult position indeed if things go badly for him...
example.tran: 如果事情进展不顺利的话，他的处境将非常艰难。

example.ex: Companies should be made to reveal more about their financial position...
example.tran: 应该要求公司使其财务状况更为透明化。

entry.def: Your position on a particular matter is your attitude towards it or your opinion of it.

example.ex: He could be depended on to take a moderate position on most of the key issues...
example.tran: 他应该会在大部分关键问题上采取中间立场。

example.ex: Mr Howard is afraid to state his true position on the republic, which is that he is opposed to it.
example.tran: 霍华德先生不敢表明自己对共和体制持反对态度的真实立场。

entry.def: If you are in a position to do something, you are able to do it. If you are in no position to do something, you are unable to do it.

example.ex: The UN system will be in a position to support the extensive relief efforts needed...
example.tran: 联合国将能满足全面救济需求。

example.ex: I am not in a position to comment.

entry.def: If someone or something is in position, they are in their correct or usual place or arrangement.

example.ex: This second door is an extra security measure and can be locked in position during the day...
example.tran: 这第二道门是又一项安全措施，白天可以上锁。

example.ex: Some 28,000 US troops are moving into position.
example.tran: 约2.8万人的美国军队即将部署到位。

means.word_mean: 1. the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object;

sentences.sentence: "he put the lamp back in its place"

means.word_mean: 2. a point occupied by troops for tactical reasons
3. a way of regarding situations or topics etc.;

sentences.sentence: "consider what follows from the positivist view"

means.word_mean: 4. position or arrangement of the body and its limbs;

sentences.sentence: "he assumed an attitude of surrender"

means.word_mean: 5. the relative position or standing of things or especially persons in a society;

sentences.sentence: "he had the status of a minor"
"the novel attained the status of a classic"
"atheists do not enjoy a favorable position in American life"
"he occupied a post in the treasury"

means.word_mean: 7. the spatial property of a place where or way in which something is situated;

sentences.sentence: "the position of the hands on the clock"
"he specified the spatial relations of every piece of furniture on the stage"
"the cars were in position"

means.word_mean: 9. (in team sports) the role assigned to an individual player;

sentences.sentence: "what position does he play?"

means.word_mean: 10. the act of putting something in a certain place or location
11. a condition or position in which you find yourself;

sentences.sentence: "the unpleasant situation (or position) of having to choose between two evils"
"found herself in a very fortunate situation"

means.word_mean: 12. an item on a list or in a sequence;

sentences.sentence: "in the second place"
"moved from third to fifth position"

means.word_mean: 14. an opinion that is held in opposition to another in an argument or dispute;

sentences.sentence: "there are two sides to every question"

means.word_mean: 15. the function or position properly or customarily occupied or served by another;

sentences.sentence: "can you go in my stead?"
"took his place"
"in lieu of"

means.word_mean: 16. the act of positing; an assumption taken as a postulate or axiom
1. cause to be in an appropriate place, state, or relation
2. put into a certain place or abstract location;

sentences.sentence: "Put your things here"
"Set the tray down"
"Set the dogs on the scent of the missing children"
"Place emphasis on a certain point"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin positio(n-), from ponere 'to place'. The current sense of the verb dates from the early 19th cent

means: 位置
姿势
地位
职位
名次
处境
立场
阵地
安放
定位
驻扎
